Use official prepaid taxi services from airports and railway stations
Negotiate auto-rickshaw fares before starting your journey or insist on meter
Drink only bottled or properly filtered water, avoid ice in drinks
Keep emergency contacts and hotel address written in Hindi and English
Be cautious of overly friendly strangers offering help or deals
Use official government tourism counters for information and bookings
Keep small denomination notes handy for tips and small purchases
Avoid displaying expensive jewelry, cameras, or large amounts of cash
Trust your instincts - if something feels wrong, remove yourself from the situation

transportation_scams.scam: Taxi drivers claiming meter is broken and quoting inflated fixed prices
transportation_scams.solution: Insist on meter or use app-based cabs like Uber/Ola. Walk away if they refuse.

transportation_scams.scam: Auto-rickshaw drivers taking longer routes to increase fare
transportation_scams.solution: Use GPS on your phone to track route. Agree on fare beforehand or insist on meter.

transportation_scams.scam: Fake prepaid taxi counters at airports charging extra fees
transportation_scams.solution: Use only official prepaid taxi counters inside airport terminals. Verify rates on display boards.

transportation_scams.scam: Drivers claiming your hotel is closed/full and offering alternatives
transportation_scams.solution: Call your hotel directly to confirm. Don't let drivers change your destination.

transportation_scams.scam: Train station touts offering to help with tickets for a fee
transportation_scams.solution: Buy tickets only from official railway counters or authorized travel agents.

shopping_scams.scam: Gem and jewelry shops offering 'export quality' deals with fake certificates
shopping_scams.solution: Only buy from government-approved shops. Verify certifications independently.

shopping_scams.scam: Carpet and handicraft shops pressuring for immediate purchase with 'special discounts'
shopping_scams.solution: Take time to compare prices. Don't be pressured into immediate decisions.

shopping_scams.scam: Fake branded goods sold as originals in markets
shopping_scams.solution: Buy branded items only from authorized retailers. If price seems too good, it's likely fake.

shopping_scams.scam: Overcharging tourists in markets and shops
shopping_scams.solution: Research fair prices beforehand. Bargain respectfully but firmly.

shopping_scams.scam: Credit card skimming in unauthorized shops
shopping_scams.solution: Use cash in small shops. For cards, ensure machine is official and watch the transaction.

health_safety: Carry basic first aid kit with band-aids, antiseptic, and pain relievers
Use mosquito repellent, especially during monsoon season
Avoid raw vegetables and fruits from street vendors
Get travel insurance that covers medical emergencies
Know location of nearest hospital to your accommodation
Carry any prescription medications in original containers
Be cautious of air pollution - consider wearing masks on high pollution days
cultural_etiquette: Remove shoes before entering temples, mosques, and some homes
Dress modestly when visiting religious sites - cover shoulders and legs
Use right hand for eating, greeting, and giving/receiving items
Don't point feet toward people or religious objects
Ask permission before photographing people, especially women
Respect local customs during festivals and religious observances
Learn basic Hindi greetings like 'Namaste' and 'Dhanyawad' (thank you)
